txt.en: The Dog-catcher, Part 4
Check on Namâkh
Help Niriga out of the burning building
Barûl's voice rings out, and his shadow seems to grow
You have traced Namâkh and Barûl to this house in Urmâkh. Inside, the smell is musty, infused with the scent of blood. As you enter, you see Namâkh bound in the corner, with Barûl standing over him.
'Do not harm my husband, please!'
'We have little money, but what we have is yours if you free him!'
'Please, you have such a beautiful face. Do not harm my husband.'
Listen to Barûl and Niriga.
Defeat Barûl.
Defeat Barûl
Defeat Barûl.
Listen to Barûl and Niriga
Listen to Barûl.
Defeat Barûl
Listen to Barûl
Check on Namâkh.
'I can no longer play at pretense.'
'You do not appeal to me directly, and perhaps you should have.'
Help Niriga out of the burning building.
'This isn't my face. I just wear it sometimes.'
'Stop with your pathetic attacks.'
'Do you not know who I am?'
'I AM THE HUNGRY STORM, AND I TAKE WHAT I PLEASE.'
'His life means nothing to me, a day's distraction, and I take it anyway.'
'As for you, [placeholder]. I will see you again, and soon.'
Namâkh is dead, his body broken, as though tossed by a storm
